arm_group.description: Unilateral massage on the left side of the body.
Unilateral massage on the right side of the body.
Traditional massage on the back of the body.

brief_summary.textblock:
In depression, EEG studies have shown frontal asymmetry with relatively lower activity in
      the left hemisphere.  In this study a moderate pressure massage will be conducted by a
      trained professional on one of the following conditions: the right side of the body, the
      left side of the body, or both sides of the body (a traditional massage on the back of the
      body) while EEG measurements of brain activity are recorded and mood ratings are obtained.

clinical_study.brief_title: Unilateral Massage as a Potential Treatment for Depression

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Medically and mentally healthy, right-handed participants will be eligible for
             participating in this study. The age range for enrollment in the study is not
             restricted by any variables but will be set between 18 and 50 years of age.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Left-Handed subjects, persons suffering acute or chronic mental illnesses and chronic
             illnesses (including autoimmune illnesses).

intervention.description: Unilateral massage on the left side of the body.
intervention.other_name: Massage on the left side of the body.

clinical_study.official_title: Unilateral Massage as a Potential Treatment for Depression

primary_outcome.description: EEG recording using an electrode cap and electrode gel connected to an EEG Machine to record brain activity.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Collected 4 minutes after the unilateral massage has ended.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To obtain mood ratings before and after the UMI.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected immediately following the unilateral massage.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
